metadata.title: CVE-2023-42795 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Incomplete Cleanup vulnerability in Apache Tomcat.When recycling variousinternal objects in Apache Tomcat from 11.0.0-M1 through 11.0.0-M11, from10.1.0-M1 through 10.1.13, from 9.0.0-M1 through 9.0.80 and from 8.5.0through 8.5.93, an error could cause Tomcat to skip some parts of therecycling process leading to information leaking from the currentrequest/response to the next. Users are recommended to upgrade to version11.0.0-M12 onwards, 10.1.14 onwards, 9.0.81 onwards or 8.5.94 onwards,which fixes the issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtomcat9-embed-java - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm4
libtomcat9-java - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm4
tomcat9 - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm4
tomcat9-admin - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm4
tomcat9-common - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm4
tomcat9-examples - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm4
tomcat9-user - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat8 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
tomcat9 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm4').
